aboutText: The PMI Project of the Year Award, PMI Large and Mega Project Award, and PMI Small and Mid-Size Project Award recognize complex projects that best deliver superior performance of project management practices, expert organizational results, and positive impacts on society.

subtitle: The National Bank of Bahrain, TATA Consultancy Services, and Accenture Consulting Firm
description: The Tylos project was a remarkable triumph, replacing core banking systems in the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, and Bahrain within four years, despite COVID-19 challenges. Overcoming obstacles like custom software versions and integrating 40 peripheral systems in Bahrain, it was still efficiently executed. Key success factors included seamless collaboration between the National Bank of Bahrain (NBB) and partners, with over 100 weekly Steering Committee meetings for alignment. An effective communication strategy raised awareness and maintained positive relationships. Despite the high-risk approach, the program was a resounding success with no operational disruptions. Identified issues were promptly addressed, causing minimal disturbance. The Tylos project showcased the effectiveness of teamwork, governance, and communication in complex transformations, highlighting NBB's commitment to excellence and innovation.

images.imageCaption: The United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, and Bahrain came together under the Tylos Initiative to modernize their banking systems, and what they managed to accomplish in less than four years is nothing short of extraordinary.

In a world where we often focus on what separates us, the Tylos project stands as a compelling testament to what we can achieve when we come together, work towards a common goal, and revolutionize an industry.
